document.heading: Homestead Exemption Penalty Expansion Amendment Act of 1997

history.narrative: Law 12-38, the “Homestead Exemption Penalty Expansion Amendment Act of 1997,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-179, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 17, 1997, and July 1, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 17, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-140 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-38 became effective on October 23, 1997.
